item.title: Flipboardは、1,000誌以上のソーシャル雑誌をフェデレーションバースに投入し、ユーザーはMastodonのようなフェデレーションソーシャルアプリから雑誌を見つけることができるようになった（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
Flipboard has launched more than 1,000 of its social magazines in the fediverse, allowing users to find the magazines via federated social apps like Mastodon  —  The fediverse just got a little bigger today as Flipboard has now launched over 1,000 of its social magazines across the decentralized social web …

Axel Springer announces its first US leadership team, a 10-person group that includes Politico Europe co-founder Gabriel Brotman, a sign of its US ambitions  —  The 10-person cohort includes five new hires and points toward centralization  —  German media company Axel Springer announced …

item.title: テレビ放送事業をカバーするTVNewsCheckは、ウェブサイトとニュースレターの更新を停止するが、イベントとウェビナーは継続すると発表した（Matthew Keys/The Desk）
item.description:
Matthew Keys / The Desk:
TVNewsCheck, which covers the TV broadcasting business, says it is suspending updates to its website and newsletters but will continue its events and webinars  —  TV NewsCheck, a popular online publication that covers the television broadcast industry, says it will temporarily stop publishing new articles …

item.title: Dall-EとMidjourneyに後押しされ、ブランドの安全性とIP保護を強調することでツールの差別化を図るアドビが、AIを慎重に採用している様子（Bloomberg）
item.description:
Bloomberg:
A look at Adobe's careful adoption of AI, pushed by Dall-E and Midjourney, as it tries to differentiate its tools by emphasizing brand safety and IP protections  —  Dall-E and Midjourney pushed the Photoshop behemoth to develop Firefly, a suite of AI tools.  Will creatives get on board?

item.title: メカニカル・ライセンシング・コレクティブがパンドラを提訴、広告収入層を含む毎月のロイヤリティの支払いと報告を適切に行わなかったとして（Kristin Robinson/Billboard）
item.description:
Kristin Robinson / Billboard:
The Mechanical Licensing Collective sues Pandora for allegedly failing to adequately pay and report monthly royalties, including for its ad-supported tier  —  This is the first time the mechanical licensing organization has filed a lawsuit against a streaming service.

item.title: 出典DCGは2016年にCoinDeskを50万ドルで買収後、2023年11月に7000万ドルから8000万ドルで売却（Leo Schwartz/Fortune）
item.description:
Leo Schwartz / Fortune:
Source: DCG sold CoinDesk for between $70M to $80M in November 2023 after buying it for $500K in 2016  —  When CoinDesk published a suspicious balance sheet of Sam Bankman-Fried's trading firm in November of 2022, it set off a chain of events that would upend every corner of the crypto industry—including its own.

item.title: 米判事、OpenAIは著作権保護された書籍の使用によるCA不正競争防止法違反の訴えに応じなければならないとする一方、DMCA違反など一部の訴えを棄却（Ernesto Van der Sar/TorrentFreak）
item.description:
Ernesto Van der Sar / TorrentFreak:
A US judge says OpenAI must face a claim of violating CA unfair competition law by using copyrighted books, but dismisses some claims like DMCA violations  —  In recent months, rightsholders of all ilks have filed lawsuits against companies that develop AI models.

item.title: メモ：パラマウントがコスト削減のためレイオフを開始、情報筋によれば、全部門で推定従業員数の3％にあたる800人程度が削減されるとのこと（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Memo: Paramount starts layoffs to reduce costs; sources say ~800 employees, or an estimated 3% of its headcount, are getting cut across all divisions  —  Paramount Global, amid a swirl of M&A discussions, is laying off about 800 employees worldwide — an estimated 3% of its headcount — as it looks to trim costs.

item.title: BBCによると、iPlayerストリーミングサービスは、コストと利用率の低さを理由に、2024年3月にPCとMacでの番組ダウンロードのサポートを終了するが、モバイルは影響を受けない（Chris Vallance/BBC）
item.description:
Chris Vallance / BBC:
The BBC says its iPlayer streaming service will stop supporting PC and Mac program downloads in March 2024, citing cost and low usage, but mobile is unaffected  —  The BBC's iPlayer streaming service is to end downloads for users who watch on desktop or laptop computers.

item.title: メモシリウスXMは、2023年3月に従業員の8%にあたる475人を解雇した後、従業員の3%にあたる160人を削減する計画だ（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Memo: SiriusXM plans to cut ~160 jobs, or ~3% of its workforce, after laying off 475 employees, or ~8% of its workforce, in March 2023  —  SiriusXM is eliminating about 160 jobs, a move to cut expenses that represents a layoff affecting just under 3% of the satellite radio and audio streamer's workforce.
